intro: Oerstedina, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their smooth, often ribbed stems and heart-shaped leaves. They produce small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Oerstedina species are generally herbaceous perennials, with some species growing as shrubs.
